Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in determining that the applicants were not Convention refugees or persons in need of protection
Procedural_Context: Judicial review of refugee claim decision
Credibility_Assessment: Principal applicant's inconsistent statements undermined credibility
Evidence_Type: Credible evidence of state protection in Peru, internal flight alternative in Lima
Legal_Provision: IRPA provisions on Convention refugee status and person in need of protection
Basis_of_Claim: Persecution by Shining Path and DINCOTE in Peru
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Credibility, existence of internal flight alternative, state protection
Regulation_Cited: IRPA sections related to refugee status and protection
Application_Error: Alleged error in assessing lack of state protection and internal flight alternative
Legal_Standard: Burden on claimant to prove lack of state protection and no viable internal flight alternative
Application_Factor: Credibility of applicant, availability of IFA, effectiveness of state protection
Decision_Review_Issue: Error in credibility assessment, application of IFA, and state protection analysis
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA, Article 96 and 97; principles of refugee determination
Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credible basis for fear of persecution, availability of internal flight alternative, effective state protection
Credibility_Issues: Yes – principal applicant made inconsistent statements
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claimants challenged reasonableness of Board's decision
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Canadian jurisprudence on refugee claims
